company_command.name: Company Command
company_command.description: A higher-ranking field officer trained to command more units and occasionally direct field operations.

platoon_command.name: Platoon Command
platoon_command.description: A lower-ranking platoon commander to provide support to other field units.

veteran_platoon_command.name: Veteran Platoon Command
veteran_platoon_command.description: A lower-ranking platoon commander to provide support to other field units.

forward_artillery_observer.name: Forward Artillery Observer
forward_artillery_observer.description: An artillery forward observer able to call in a fire mission.

field_medic.name: Field Medic
field_medic.description: A trained field medic used to treat the wounded near the frontline.

volkssturm.name: Volkssturm
volkssturm.description: Cheap infantry to be used en-masse to take and hold the field.
volkssturm.background: The Volkssturm 'people's storm', a group of conscripted males between 16-60, who weren't previously in another military unit. This national militia, was not part of the Germany Army, was instead raised, recruited, and armed by the Nazi Party. The Volkssturm was part of the doctrine of 'total war', a heavily ideologically colored endeavor to win the war with sheer force of will.

volksgrenadiers.name: Volksgrenadiers
volksgrenadiers.description: Cheaper infantry with the ability to take several assault rifles and hit targets reasonably well.
volksgrenadiers.background: Volksgrenadiers, 'Peoples Grenadiers'. Due to a shortage of manpower and the abundance of enemies with large populations, the Volksgrenadiers were units that conserved manpower and maximized automatic firepower, along with recent technological advances. They were made up of a mixture of hardened veteran troops, 'jobless' personnel from other branches of the Germany Armed Forces, recently healed soldiers who had been wounded, and younger/older men recently recruited with the widened age range of conscription.

aufklarungs_squad.name: Aufklarungs Squad
aufklarungs_squad.description: A recon squad with the ability to take some heavier anti-infantry firepower.
aufklarungs_squad.background: The Aufklärungsabteilung (Reconnaissance Detachment) was a formation of aggressive recon troops, which provided the 'eyes and ears' of each German Army division..

osttruppen.name: Osttruppen
osttruppen.description: Reasonably well-equipped and trained troops, osttruppen are not eager to fight the enemies of Germany.
osttruppen.background: The Osttruppen (eastern troops), also known as 'Ostlegionen' (eastern legions), were captured soviet and slavic infantry prisoners of war. While many common terms for these troops, in many languages, translated to 'Volunteer', the terms mainly appeared to sarcastic and/or meant to be insulting. These slavic infantry were viewed as 'sub-human' by the Nazis, and it appeared those who actually volunteered, had done so to escape the horrors of the POW camps. These troops were given some of the worst equipment and positioned into roles of logistics, or 'bandit fighting' (Punishing civilians).

Strafbataillon.name: Strafbataillon
Strafbataillon.description: Particularly tough troops who can put up a fight in close combat. Not especially motivated however.
Strafbataillon.background: Strafbatallion (Penal Battalion) generally refers to a few different terms, for units that were recruited or formed from those who had too much 'indiscipline' or 'rebellious behavior' to serve as traditional conscripts. There are strong indications that as the war progressed and turned for the worse for the Nazi regime, the various populations of those sentenced to death for treason or even perhaps murder, were put under strong supervision and sent out to fight. Most of these units spent the bulk of their time doing hard labor and being part of 'suicide missions', at least in the early part of the war. Generally, there was less then stellar discipline  within these units, and they were rarely equipped well.

grenadiers.name: Grenadiers
grenadiers.description: The main versatile infantry unit of the German army. Can be equipped with anti-tank weaponry and deadly belt-fed machine-guns.

veteran_grenadiers.name: Veteran Grenadiers
veteran_grenadiers.description: The main versatile infantry unit of the German army. Can be equipped with anti-tank weaponry and deadly belt-fed machine-guns. These troops have seen combat and survived while being better motivated.

jagers.name: Jägers
jagers.description: Elite troops trained to operate in mountainous areas with expert marksmanship.

veteran_jagers.name: Veteran Jägers
veteran_jagers.description: Elite troops trained to operate in mountainous areas with expert marksmanship.

inexperienced_fallschirmjager.name: Inexperienced Fallschirmjager
inexperienced_fallschirmjager.description: German paratroopers which have been pushed out to the field before being fully trained with little combat experience.

fallschirmjager.name: Fallschirmjager
fallschirmjager.description: Elite German paratroopers with an abundance of either assault rifles or light machine guns.

veteran_fallschirmjager.name: Veteran Fallschirmjager
veteran_fallschirmjager.description: Elite German paratroopers with an abundance of either assault rifles or light machine guns. Particularly battle-hardened and more survivable.

panzergrenadiers.name: Panzergrenadiers
panzergrenadiers.description: Well-trained infantry units who typically operate with mechanized or armored units. Can be equipped with more machine-guns.

veteran_panzergrenadiers.name: Veteran Panzergrenadiers
veteran_panzergrenadiers.description: Well-trained infantry units who typically operate with mechanized or armored units. Can be equipped with more machine-guns. Particularly battle-hardened and more survivable.

brandenburgers.name: Brandenburgers
brandenburgers.description: German special-forces infiltration units with elite training and expert marksmanship.

sturm_pioniers.name: Sturmpioniere
sturm_pioniers.description: German engineers which can be equipped to clear battlefield dangers or fight in deadly assaults.

pioniers.name: Pioniers
pioniers.description: German engineers which can be equipped to clear battlefield dangers or fight in deadly assaults.

panzer_zerstor_trupp.name: Panzer-Zerstörer Trupp
panzer_zerstor_trupp.description: A dedicated tank hunting unit which can be equipped with various tank-hunting weapons.
panzer_zerstor_trupp.background: A professional and specialized team for defeating tanks via throwables, traps, and demolition charges. It consists of a leader and runner, a security team, a smoke team, and a demolition team. These teams each operate somewhat independently of each other, and were adapted or modified according to local conditions.

flamethrower_team.name: Flamethrower Team
flamethrower_team.description: A team equipped to clear bunkers and other defensive positions.

sniper_team.name: Sniper Team
sniper_team.description: A team equipped to take out important targets from a distance.

at_rifle_team.name: AT Rifle Team
at_rifle_team.description: A team dedicated to hunting lighter tanks.

panzerknacker_team.name: Panzerknacker Team
panzerknacker_team.description: A team dedicated to hunting tanks with anti-tank grenades.

panzershreck_team.name: Panzerschreck Team
panzershreck_team.description: A team dedicated to hunting heavy tanks.

veteran_panzershreck_team.name: Veteran Panzerschreck Team
veteran_panzershreck_team.description: A team dedicated to hunting heavy tanks. Elite and more accurate.

mmg_team.name: Tripod MG Team
mmg_team.description: A medium machine-gun on a tripod mount.

light_mortar_team.name: Light Mortar Team
light_mortar_team.description: A light mortar carried by a small team.

medium_mortar_team.name: Medium Mortar Team
medium_mortar_team.description: A medium mortar carried by a small team.

heavy_mortar_team.name: Heavy Mortar Team
heavy_mortar_team.description: A heavy mortar carried by a small team.

schweres_wurfgerats.name: Schweres Wurfgerats
schweres_wurfgerats.description: A wheeled light rocket artillery piece.

150mm_nebelwerfer.name: 150mm Nebelwerfer 41
150mm_nebelwerfer.description: A wheeled light rocket artillery piece.

pak_43.name: Pak 43 AT Gun
pak_43.description: A wheeled very heavy at gun.

flakvierling.name: Flakvierling 38
flakvierling.description: A wheeled quad light anti-aircraft autocannon.

sdkfz_223_command.name: Sdkfz 223 (Command)
sdkfz_223_command.description: An armored command car with a supporting MG.

sdkfz_222.name: Sdkfz 222-223
sdkfz_222.description: An armored recon car with a powerful autocannon.

sdkfz_231.name: Sdkfz 231
sdkfz_231.description: An armored recon car with a powerful autocannon.

panzer_38t.name: Panzer 35(t)/38(t)
panzer_38t.description: A medium tank with a good main gun.

flammpanzer_ii.name: Flammpanzer II
flammpanzer_ii.description: A light tank with a several flame weapons.

panzer_ii_a_f.name: Panzer II A-F/"Luchs"
panzer_ii_a_f.description: A light tank with a decent anti-infantry weapon.

panzer_iii_c_f.name: Panzer III C-F
panzer_iii_c_f.description: A medium tank with a good main gun.

panzer_iii_j.name: Panzer III J
panzer_iii_j.description: A medium tank with a good main gun.

flammpanzer_iii.name: Flammpanzer III
flammpanzer_iii.description: A medium tank fitted with a turret flamethrower.

stug_III_a_e.name: Stug III A-E
stug_III_a_e.description: An early infantry support medium tank with a fixed howitzer.

stug_III_f_h.name: Stug III F-H/Stug IV
stug_III_f_h.description: A medium tank with a fixed powerful main gun.

hetzer.name: Jagdpanzer 38(t) Hetzer
hetzer.description: A medium tank with a fixed powerful main gun.

flammpanzer_38t.name: Flammpanzer 38(t)
flammpanzer_38t.description: A medium tank with a fixed powerful main gun.

borgward_wanze.name: Borgward Wanze
borgward_wanze.description: A lightly armored car with anti-tank weaponry.

marder_ii_iii_m.name: Marder II/III H/M
marder_ii_iii_m.description: An late war open-topped tank destroyer.

jagdtiger.name: Jagdtiger
jagdtiger.description: A heavy tank with a super powerful fixed main gun.

panzer_iv_a.name: Panzer IV A
panzer_iv_a.description: A medium tank with an infantry support howitzer.

panzer_iv_b_f.name: Panzer IV B-F
panzer_iv_b_f.description: A medium tank with a powerful main gun.

panzer_iv_j.name: Panzer IV G-J
panzer_iv_j.description: A medium tank with a powerful main gun.

panzer_iv_command.name: Panzer IV G-J (Command)
panzer_iv_command.description: A medium tank with a powerful main gun.

panther.name: Panther G
panther.description: A medium tank with a very powerful main gun.

panther_command.name: Panther G (Command)
panther_command.description: A medium tank with a very powerful main gun.

tiger_i.name: Tiger I
tiger_i.description: A heavy tank with a very powerful main gun.

tiger_i_command.name: Tiger I (Command)
tiger_i_command.description: A heavy tank with a very powerful main gun.

tiger_ii.name: Tiger II "King Tiger"
tiger_ii.description: A heavy tank with a super powerful main gun.

hummel.name: Hummel
hummel.description: A lighter artillery vehicle with a powerful gun.

panzerwerfer_42.name: Panzerwerfer 42
panzerwerfer_42.description: A lighter artillery vehicle with attached rocket launcher.

sdkfz_251_stuka.name: Sdfkz 251 "Stuka Zu Fuss"
sdkfz_251_stuka.description: A lightly armored mechanized transport with attached rocket launcher.

stuh_42.name: Stuh 42
stuh_42.description: A later war infantry support medium tank.

brummbar.name: Brummbar
brummbar.description: A heavier assault tank with infantry support howitzer.

sturmtiger.name: Sturmtiger
sturmtiger.description: A super heavy assault tank with infantry support rocket mortar.

stug_33b.name: Stug 33b
stug_33b.description: An early infantry support medium tank with a fixed howitzer.

mobelwagen.name: Mobelwagen
mobelwagen.description: A medium tank with a powerful main gun.

ostwind.name: Ostwind
ostwind.description: A medium tank with a powerful main gun.

wirbelwind.name: Wirbelwind
wirbelwind.description: A medium tank with a powerful main gun.

dfs_230_glider.name: DFS 230 Glider
dfs_230_glider.description: A lightweight glider used to transport troops to the battlefield.

me_bf109_g.name: BF-109 G-6
me_bf109_g.description: A relatively tough general purpose aircraft.

ju_87d.name: Ju 87 B-1
ju_87d.description: A bomber aircraft with several armaments.

ju_87b1.name: Ju 87 D
ju_87b1.description: A dive bomber aircraft with defense machine-guns.

sturm_assault.name: Sturm Assault
sturm_assault.flavor: A swift and deadly end to a fight can come with a furious charge...
sturm_assault.description: Use when an _Infantry_ unit declares a Charge action. It gets +3" of Movement for that action.

suppressive_fire.name: Suppressive Fire
suppressive_fire.flavor: With high rate of fire and a terrifying noise, machineguns can be used to pin down enemy troops with ease.
suppressive_fire.description: Use when an _Infantry_ unit that contains an LMG or Medium MG fires. If the attack hits, it assigns 2 additional shock to all affected targets.

panzer_blitz.name: Panzer Blitz
panzer_blitz.flavor: A swift and deadly Panzer assault can sometimes route the enemy.
panzer_blitz.description: Use when a _Tank_ unit makes a Move action. Add +3" to its Move characteristic.

kochs_commandos.name: Koch's Commandos
kochs_commandos.description: This unit and one other friendly _Infantry_ unit may be set up in _outflanking reserves_. These units may arrive on any table edge including your opponents reinforcement edge.

desert_fox.name: Desert Fox
desert_fox.description: This unit and one other friendly _Tank_ or _Armored Car_ unit may be set up in _outflanking reserves_. These units may arrive on any table edge including your opponents reinforcement edge.

crack_shot.name: Crack Shot
crack_shot.description: This unit get +1 Accuracy and enemies hit by his attacks add one to rolls on damage tables.

ambush_master.name: Ambush Master
ambush_master.description: This unit get +1 Accuracy when using an Ambush reaction.

move_move_move_infantry.name: Move Move Move
move_move_move_infantry.description: This unit and friendly _Infantry_ units within 6" add 2" to their Movement characteristic.

hans_von_luck_infantry.name: Hans von Luck (Infantry)
hans_von_luck_infantry.flavor: Hans von Luck specialized in mobile recon and aggressive tactics.
hans_von_luck_infantry.description: Upgrade one Field Officer model with Move Move Move.

ernst_barkmann.name: Ernst Barkmann
ernst_barkmann.flavor: Ernst Barkmann was an ace tank commander who served throughout the war.
ernst_barkmann.description: Upgrade one Panther (Command) with Crack Shot.

walter_koch.name: Walter Koch
walter_koch.flavor: Walter Koch was a captain of the fallschirmjager following some early success in the war.
walter_koch.description: Upgrade one Field Officer or Higher Officer with Koch's Commandos.

erwin_rommel.name: Erwin Rommel
erwin_rommel.flavor: Erwin Rommel, was known to expertly outflank and surprise his enemies.
erwin_rommel.description: Upgrade one Tank (Command) with Desert Fox.

michael_wittman.name: Michael Wittmann
michael_wittman.flavor: Michael Wittman as an expert in Ambush and surprise often attacking his enemies when they least expect it.
michael_wittman.description: Upgrade one Tiger (Command) or Panzer IV (Command) with Ambush Master.
